Sentencas: Proton-conducting ceramic oxides working in the temperature range from 500 degrees C to 900 degrees C may be applied in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC), electrolysis cells, H(2) separators, gas sensors and other devices.
Titulo: Structure and electrical properties of ceramic proton conductors obtained with molten-salt and solid-state synthesis methods

Sentencas: The structure, microstructure and electrical properties of the samples synthesized with the conventional solid-state method (SS) and the composite samples obtained with the TGG method are compared.
